intro: Macrolepis longiscapa, commonly known as the long-stemmed beard-plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
